name: Volunteers of America (mid-states) Freedom House
description: Freedom House is a comprehensive substance abuse treatment program for women with children, operated by Volunteers of America Mid-States. The program allows children under 18 to stay with their mothers during treatment, providing family-centered recovery services including individual and group therapy, parenting classes, life skills training, and medication-assisted treatment.
source: Verified from official VOA Mid-States website
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
eligibility_requirements: Women with substance use disorders who have children under 18. No limit on number of children that can stay with mother.
populations_served: Women with substance use disorders, pregnant women, mothers with children under 18, families affected by addiction
cost_information: Contact for current pricing and insurance information. Some funding assistance may be available.
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2024-12-19. CITATIONS: Contact information verified from official VOA Mid-States website https://www.voamid.org/locations/freedom-house/. Phone number (502) 635-4530 confirmed working. Email intakears@voamid.org verified from website. Multiple locations available: 1436 Shelby Street Louisville KY 40217, 1025 2nd Street Louisville KY 40203, and 8467 N Hwy 421 Manchester KY 40962. Program allows children under 18 to stay with mothers during treatment. Services include medication-assisted treatment, individual/group therapy, parenting classes, life skills training, and case management. 84% of Louisville clients saw increased visitations or reunification with children. Program established in 1993 with over 300 healthy babies born to women in treatment.
